title: I've asked everyone I know, but not a single proper answer to show for it.
body:
Masters, Bronzies, Silvers, Golds, Platinums, even one Challenger on his stream.
"What do you do against Riven."
If I even _got_ an answer, it could be summed up in this simple sentence: "Riven snowballs early, so..." followed by piercing silence, silence that speaks louder than any strategy.
I am _**DESPERATE**_. Riven is an INSTANT LOSS for me, every single time. I can't beat her, I've never beaten her, and quite frankly I doubt I will ever beat her. I can't fight the engage from half a lane away into stun/knockup + massive AD scaling shield, I can't kite her for this same reason, but we can now add an AoE ranged execute.

You are my very last hope, boards. **_Help me._**

replies.body:
I'm going to ask before writing a lengthy post:

* What is your opinion on counter-picks, altering item builds, and altering your play-style against her?

* Are there any specific champions you want advice for?
I'm willing to play literally anything and anyone if it means I can finally stop insta-tilting when I see her on the enemy team. AD Veigar? I'll do it.

General Advice:

* Riven has to play aggressively against most champions to succeed.  Call up your jungler and watch where Riven wards.
* Riven deals entirely physical damage.  If you need to, use flat Armor Quints and Seals.
* Riven will typically try to force fights early-game.  Make sure you are durable enough to survive using your runes and items so that you can farm up your items.
* Riven's health regeneration without lifesteal is horrible.  Any damage you deal to her early will stick quite well.
------------------------
Potential starting items:
{{item:1028}} {{item:1029}} {{item:1055}} {{item:1054}} 

These options all provide early durability (to survive all-ins) and decent sustain (which Riven lacks).

Ruby Crystal and Cloth Armor both build into many defensive items, which is beneficial for bruisers and tanks.
------------------------
Itemization:

If possible, you want to build an early defensive item so that Riven can't easily assassinate you.  The optimal choice will depend on the champion and enemy team composition, but the following are all good options.

{{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3191}} {{item:3027}}  {{item:3742}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3136}} 

Most of them provide a mixture of offensive and defensive stats to help you survive and kill Riven.

This is by no means inclusive as some champions are better served by sticking to their core items (i.e. Trinity Force, Guinsoo's Rageblade, Black Cleaver, Manamune) and deviating would significantly delay their main powerspike.
---------------------------------------
Playstyle:

Riven will be stronger early-game, so you have to know when to give up CS to avoid taking unnecessary damage or dying.

Freeze the minion wave outside of your tower.  If you can, then Riven will risk taking tower shots whenever she tries to harass you or farm.   It will also leave her significantly overextended and make it easy for your jungler to gank her.

Riven has long-ish cooldowns early-game and the early CDR she can purchase has been reduced.  If she wastes cooldowns to farm, it can be a good opportunity to trade with her.
------------------------------------
Class specific:

AD Bruisers (i.e. Renekton, Gnar, Illaoi, Garen, Darius) may benefit from building 2 Doran's Blade into Black Cleaver and/or Sunfire Cape, which provides a significant amount of sustain, damage, and durability early.

AP Tanks (i.e. Maokai, Cho'gath) benefit from building Rod of Ages into Frozen Heart for durability, mana, damage, and CDR.

Pure tanks (i.e. Malphite) want to build Sunfire Cape into Frozen Heart/Iceborn Gauntlet.

Taric rushes Iceborn Gauntlet into Deadman's Plate and dominates her.

Trinity Force bruisers (i.e. Irelia) should still rush Trinity Force, picking up Ninja Tabi early for damage reduction and mobility.

Mages and AP Bruisers can build 2 Doran's Rings (for mana sustain and health) into Seeker's Armguard.
------------------------------------
Counterpicks in Lane:
{{champion:44}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:54}} 

Skill Matchups in Lane:
{{champion:75}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:23}} 

-------------------------------------

If you have any specific champions you want to use against her, let me know and I can go into more detail.

I'll likely add to this later today when I have the time.

Also, keep in mind that all of this advice is based on my opinions and experience.  It may differ for other players.

I've never really played Quinn (before or after her rework) and I've not seen the matchup played.  I didn't want to comment on the matchup when I had never seen it.
Fair point.

Prettymuch everything EndlessSorcerer said.
Aditionally,  i like picking tanks into her, like nauti, malph or mao. You can easily go for early defense on them, you can affort to give up some cs early on and still scale well into teamfights, your tanky enough with some cc to survive all-in atempts, preventing her from startinh a snowball.
If you have some experience and the riven makes a mistake, you can even win 1v1 vs them(for example them trying to close from a distance with Q, just walk away and maybe slow them from afar, turn around and trade as soon as the 3ed Q is out), and their hoogd base burst+cc makes it really easy to assist ganks.
Try to hurt her tower whenever you can and end the laneingphase as early as possible. In lane, she will outscale you, cause as soon as she got lifesteal+%pen, you can't really hold your ground 1v1, but you do have more impact in teamfights and better tools to catch people.

when i played top for a few months i would often beat her with nautilus, hes not as bad at trading as people think.

I am no expert, but as Shyvana I start E vs Riven using it to last hit until she pushes the minions near my tower and then I last hit normally. Grab W lvl 2 to avoid her dash engages and burst and continue farming. Building tanky. Grab q lvl 3 then max w over the others. Over time you will outscale her and laugh at her burst.

Step 1 - Pick Garen/Nasus/Malphite/Darius
Step 2 - Stack armor
Step 3 - zzzzzzzzzz
Step 4 - Riven is useless.
Darius actually gets spanked by Riven
Only if the Darius is bad. But it's impossible to be bad at Darius.
Then I've done the impossible.
If they are the exact same skill level Riven wins
To be at the same "skill level" at their champions, Riven would need to be like Plat if Darius was Silver. And in ranked that's not really going to happen.

Im gold 2 right now. If I played Riven and another Gold 2 played Darius. I would have the upper hand assuming no jungler help from either side. 

If darius builds damage, Riven nukes him before he gets his stacks. If he builds tanky, Darius can't do enough damage through her lifesteal and she will build armor pen anyways.

also, Darius should never land his heal because every single time he goes to Q you, you E into him and trade with him. his Q does no damage on the hilt and doesn't heal and at that point Riven can engage, trade and disengage freely. Darius cannot.

Still doesn't matter. Riven will just obliterate you at level 6. Riven does way to much damage before you can get your stacks off and she can just disengage from you whenever she wants. She can choose when to trade and when not to. Darius can't choose.

If you get the chance to counter pick her, I'd recommend {{champion:86}}.  

Both are ability based and resourceless.  But Garen can silence her.  Since Riven is reliant on her abilities, silences are deadly to her.

Tbh, I play passively in lane to counter her. And by passively, I mean INCREDIBLY passively. Let her shove to tower - she will, since her abilities are AoE - and pick up whatever CS you can. If you stay far enough away, you force Riven to burn all of her movement just to get in range, which then means that you can trade favorably. 

Now, I am by no means a toplane expert, but that's my preferred strategy. EndlessSorceror probably has some better ideas than I do.

Thanks for your input, but I feel this will just allow her to tear your turret down and simply get a gold lead off CS. It could work though, for all I know this may be the Holy Grail in "how to beat Riven" strats.

She gets a gold lead, but it's not really "snowballing", per se. If Riven doesn't pick up kills in-lane, I've never found her to be _too_ oppressive. 

Concerning the tower, you can easily trade with her if she's dumb enough to walk in range and hit it. Without sufficient AD, Valor won't block the entire tower shot's damage and your damage at the same time. Sure, minions will eventually dink away enough at the tower to kill it, but if you've survived laning phase you'll be alright.

I also totally forgot - Garen is almost a 100% counter to Riven. His silence stops Riven from running or trading back, W gives him fantastic defense from her burst, and provided you hit E before getting stunned/knocked up, you're guaranteed at least some damage back. Plus, Perseverance means he'll outheal her after trades. Start with Doran's Shield and get early armor and you're fine.
Ban her

Prince Jarvin Lightshield, the fourth of his name, Exemplar of Demacia. AD bruser, damage reds and quints, armor yellows and MR blues, all flat. 6/6/18 with grasp as Keystone. Flash and Ghost for summs, starting with corrupting flask, build into Ravenous Hydra, after is up to you.

 2(she has killed you): don't go "hurr durr I need more dmg" go armor and turtle until jungler will help.

I think a really big thing in my elo is not being able to control the wave, i.e. make HER push the lane into your turret. And always remember to ward your lane.

The best thing to do against a Riven is not to 1 v 1 her unless you can play a peel champ or a tanky champ. I hate seeing a Riven, but usually I just farm in lane without pushing too much as she can destroy most top lane champs (Illaoi might be an exception). I would say that Renekton, Jayce, Darius, and Fiora should be able to hold her off, but Riven is the better team fighter out of those. You'd want a champ who can provide heavy harass to her without taking much damage in the trade.

I haven't played much top lately as I've been a jungle main though. Perhaps there is someone here with better advice than me :)
I've been looking towards Darius, Renekton and Illaoi as potential help when I face her. Those three are also some of my favorite champs, so this would definitely be beneficial.

Not saying every match goes my way, but I'm happy enough with the Tahm vs Riven matchup.

I've had success as {{champion:75}} against Riven. It's tricky, bc Nassus is super-weak early game, but if you learn how to farm safely (usually under your turret), and rush a Frozen Heart, you'll eventually out-scale her pretty hard.

I've had the same experience.  If you know how to freeze the wave outside your tower and farm properly, Riven can't really do much against you.

You have to be a bit careful early-game if the wave is too far out, but after you have Iceborn Gauntlet or Frozen Heart and ~150-200 stacks (typically achievable around 10-13 minutes), the matchup is pretty much yours.

There's a lot of good advice in this thread, but I'll add a bit of my own.

Riven, to me, can be faced in a similar manner to Yasuo and Zed: DON'T DIE PRE-6.  If you have to back multiple times, it'll hurt, but do it.  A Riven with a kill pre-6 is very difficult to face 1v1 in lane, since it'll get her her first real item and get her her ult before you do.  Most champions have a better chance against Riven once they hit 6 - yes, Riven's level 6 power spike is very big, but getting your ult can often do a lot to prevent her from killing you, especially if it's a defensive steroid, cc, or movement ability that will allow you to survive/escape her.

That said, Riven tends to have very predictable all-ins, mainly at 3 and 6.  Once she hits 6 (or if you think she's about to) be vary wary, since she is probably willing to blow her flash for an all-in.

Play a counter 

{{champion:133}} learn to E cancel her third Q animation and stay out of range of her Q1 & Q2 while poking her down & farming then it becomes really easy match up unless the riven is vastly more experienced with the match-up than you, biggest danger is E>Flash>W to watch out for.

{{champion:58}} he's just able to bully her so hard as long you properly use your abilities, start cloth if you need to as post 6 & haven't died you basically won the lane, because your ult > hers in a 1 vs 1 every time.  

{{champion:86}} Silence > Spin > regen > repeat til in range for R kill > kill with R

{{champion:86}}  and {{champion:17}}  are hard Counters for her

Garen has a Silence, after which he can deal his dmg with e and back off when the silence is over. This way he can chunk her down till he can destroy her with his Ult.
Teemo on the other side, should poke all time with autos and q, use w to run as soon as you see the first Riven q hop and place Ult mushrooms behind him, so she has to eat poison everytime she wants to go ham.

Generally, try to let her waste her q or w on minions, then act. Best case scenario is when she q´d once to cs, you stand back like 2-3 secs and then charge on her, since q should be on cooldown. Also try to turn her typical "Full ham, Red Eyed" Strategy against her.

I, for example, play {{champion:27}}  often, which i can use to w+e her into my tower when she wants to go full ham, lets her get at least hit twice and breath poison on top of that.

Hope this helps

You can play someone who can kite her. I play Ezreal and Karma top from time to time and it's a rather even lane. She will full to dead you but you have the range to not get got. It's not a counter, but it's not insta lose.

{{item:1029}} 

The pre-season broke Riven's knees, build armour first, and it almost doesn't matter who you're playing. If you get a chance to counterpick her, that helps too, but unless you picked Vlad top, there's not many champions who simply 'auto lose' if she plays well, and even he has a nearly 50/50 WR against her nowadays. 

If you're someone who can buy it, sunfire cape just destroys her, if you're someone who can rush a Frozen Heart, do so. 

You don't even need to play all that passively, just manage your minion wave and keep track of who is taking more aggro in fights, and unless you screw up you won't die to her.
Pick something to survive lane, respect her and let her push, even if she freezes, cry for ganks and help your team by being a tank. That is all I have for you.. Riven is a bitch tbh
